meanings.definition: softer and more yielding to the touch
meanings.sent1: The new pillow is squidgier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her blanket felt squidgier after it was washed.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ears were so squidgier than a marshmallow!
meanings.sent4: The clouds looked squidgier than cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The ripe peach was squidgier than a ripe tomato.

meanings.definition: in a softer and more yielding manner
meanings.sent1: She squeezed the stress ball squidgier this time.
meanings.sent2: The fabric draped squidgier over the chair.
meanings.sent3: The dancer moved squidgier than a feather in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass squidgier during the lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The paint spread squidgier across the canvas.
